page.title: 02William Vinnicombe
page.content: William Vinnicombe of Bridgerule Bridgerule is steeped in history and it is an interesting fact that a local family built numerous properties which are very much in evidence today. Mr. William Vinnicombe (senior) built Southlands, whilst his sons William and James (all were master stone masons) built Bridgerule School in 1872. William Vinnicombe (junior) appeared to be the most prolific builder in the area, being responsible for building the Mill House (not the dwelling house) and all the outbuildings at the old Vicarage (now The Glebe), with all the stone being drawn from Churchtown Hill Quarry and Roly Poly Quarry. He also built The Villa, rebuilt The Sanctuary and was involved with many other properties in the surrounding area.
